Tucson follows as instructed.  Yet he remains reasonably calm throughout th=
e ordeal.

" if you don't mind me asking, where is it that you're taking me=
 and why?  If I've done anything to upset you I assure you that it was not =
on purpose."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Sep 13, 201=
1, at 12:33 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> determin=
ation of his situation was confirmed. But he > knew he couldn't just attack=
 them. Perhaps if he went with them he might > just stumble upon the others=
. > > " Hmmm, in that case I suppose I better follow you. Fine, I will go w=
ith > you." Indeed! These soldiers were not as large or as powerful as GRIM=
LOCK and his men were, in fact all of them were smaller then GRIMLOCK, alth=
ough the lead figure only slightly. However there was still three of them a=
gainst his one, and he was injured from his last attack, it was a reseanabl=
e strategy to hold off until he knew more. The lead soldier, the musterd ye=
llow soldier that had a Tricerotop's head for a right hand nodded, "You hav=
e made a wise choice in surrendering." Thge others two chuckled from either=
side of TUSCON, "Commander Guiledart, shall we kill him now?" Said one of t=
he soldiers. GUILEDART shook his head, "No Hardhead." He said as he looked =
at TUSCON sqaurely. "He fought like a leader, like a warrior, I am sure tha=
t our master will have questions for him. Looking at HARDHEAD fror a moment=
 as if to make his point clear he spoke, "You and HYDRA keep an optic on hi=
m while we take him back to base." he shook his head, "No shooting." They b=
oth nodded as they raised their weapons and pointed them at TUSCON, HARDHEA=
D looking a little disappointed. "This way!" GUILDART said to TUSCON as he =
gestured for him to follow. (TAG) Preston There was a chuckle from either s=
ide of TUSCON from the soldiers that were helping to detain him. --zapQMmcu=

v>" if you don't mind me asking, where is it that you're taking me and why?=
  If I've done anything to upset you I assure you that it was not on p=
urpose."<br><br>Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. </div><di=

Indeed! These soldiers were not as large or as powerful as GRI=
MLOCK
and his men were, in fact all of them were smaller then GRIMLOCK,
alt=
hough the lead figure only slightly. However there was still three
of them =
against his one, and he was injured from his last attack, it
was a reseanab=
le strategy to hold off until he knew more.

The lead soldier, the musterd =
yellow soldier that had a Tricerotop's
head for a right hand nodded, "You h=
ave made a wise choice in
surrendering."

Thge others two chuckled from eit=
herside of TUSCON, "Commander
Guiledart, shall we kill him now?" Said one o=
f the soldiers.

GUILEDART shook his head, "No Hardhead." He said as he loo=
ked at
TUSCON sqaurely. "He fought like a leader, like a warrior, I am sure=

that our master will have questions for him.

Looking at HARDHEAD fror a m=
oment as if to make his point clear he
spoke, "You and HYDRA keep an optic =
on him while we take him back to
base." he shook his head, "No shooting."

=
They both nodded as they raised their weapons and pointed them at
TUSCON, H=
ARDHEAD looking a little disappointed.

"This way!" GUILDART said to TUSCON=
 as he gestured for him to follow.

(TAG)

Preston



There was a chuckle f=
rom either side of TUSCON from the soldiers that
were helping to detain him=
.
